resources.string: Type in a dog breed, please!
Congratulations! The dog %s of breed %s has earned the qualification %s with %d faults!
The dog %s of breed %s has not earned a qualification this time! Next time you will do better!

(1) Total Faults will be calculated as the sum of Course Faults and Time Faults

 (2) Course Faults (each in unit of five): 
- Handler touches the dog
- Handler touches an obstacle
- Dog traverses in incorrect order
- Handler goes under or over obstacle
- Knockdowns
- Refusals (dog stops in front of an obstacle or on the course, dog runs by an obstacle, etc.)

 (3) Time Faults will be added for exceeding the Standard Course Time (a single fault per second)

 (4) Elimination from competition:
- Refusal of an obstacle not corrected
- Unseemly behaviour towards the judge
- Harsh handling of the dog
- Exceeding the Maximum Course Time
- Three refusals
- Taking obstacles out of sequence
- Forgetting to take an obstacle
- Taking an obstacle in the wrong direction
- Handler negotiates an obstacle himself, jumps or passes under the obstacle
- Handler holds something in his hand
- Dog wearing a collar
- Stopping on the course because the handler retires (unless instructed by the judge)
- Dog fouls or leaves the ring or is no longer under control
- Dog snapping constantly at the handler
- Starting the run before the judgeâ€™s start signal
"
